intro: Crepis ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to brown ray florets. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and often grows in grassy areas and along roadsides. Crepis ambigua is characterized by its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its adaptability to different environmental conditions.
